Class TextDocument

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.queensu.cs.dal.edfmwk.doc.AbstractDocument
      • editor.TextDocument
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ca.queensu.cs.dal.edfmwk.doc.Document, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.DocumentListener

    public class TextDocument
extends ca.queensu.cs.dal.edfmwk.doc.AbstractDocument
implements javax.swing.event.DocumentListener
    Implementation of a text document, which is (indirectly) defined in terms of a Swing javax.swing.Document.

    Copyright 2010 David Alex Lamb. See the copyright notice for details.

      • save

        public void save(java.io.OutputStream out)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Saves the entire document. After this operation completes successfully, AbstractDocument.isChanged() returns false
        Specified by:
        save in interface ca.queensu.cs.dal.edfmwk.doc.Document
        Parameters:
        out - Where to write the document.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any I/O errors occur, in which case it will have closed the stream; isChanged() is unchanged.

      • getContentsStream

        public java.io.InputStream getContentsStream()
                                      throws ca.queensu.cs.dal.edfmwk.doc.DocumentException
        Gets an input stream from which the document contents can be read as a stream of bytes. This is required when running in a sandbox, where javax.jnlp.FileSaveService#saveAsFileDialog does not provide a means of supplying an output stream to which to write the internal representation. Document managers should avoid using this method wherever possible, preferring save(java.io.OutputStream) instead.
        Specified by:
        getContentsStream in interface ca.queensu.cs.dal.edfmwk.doc.Document
        Overrides:
        getContentsStream in class ca.queensu.cs.dal.edfmwk.doc.AbstractDocument
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if such a stream cannot be created.
        ca.queensu.cs.dal.edfmwk.doc.DocumentException

      • open

        public void open(java.io.InputStream in)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads the entire document, and closes the stream from which it is read.
        Specified by:
        open in interface ca.queensu.cs.dal.edfmwk.doc.Document
        Parameters:
        in - Where to read the document from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if any I/O errors occur, in which case it will have closed the stream.
